modules.title: The Ukrainian Alphabet
modules.description: Learn the 33 letters of the beautiful Ukrainian alphabet.

lessons.title: Introduction to Cyrillic
lessons.content:
Welcome!

The Ukrainian alphabet, called 'алфавіт' or 'абетка', is based on the Cyrillic script. It has 33 letters. Many might look familiar, but some have different sounds. Let's start with the first few.

lessons.title: Vowels
lessons.content:
Vowels (Голосні)

Ukrainian has 10 vowels: а, е, є, и, і, ї, о, у, ю, я. They are key to pronunciation!

lessons.title: Consonants
lessons.content:
Consonants (Приголосні)

Let's look at some consonants. Б (b), В (v), Г (h), Ґ (g), Д (d). Notice the sound of Г is like 'h' in 'hello'.

modules.title: Basic Greetings
modules.description: How to say hello, goodbye, and thank you.

lessons.title: Hello and Goodbye
lessons.content:
Greetings

The most common informal greeting is Привіт (pryvit). For formal situations or saying 'good day', use Добрий день (dobryi den).

To say goodbye, use До побачення (do pobachennia).

lessons.title: Essential Politeness
lessons.content:
Polite Phrases

Always use Дякую (diakuiu) for 'Thank you' and Будь ласка (bud laska) for 'Please' or 'You're welcome'.

modules.title: Food & Drink
modules.description: Learn essential vocabulary for food and ordering at a restaurant.

lessons.title: Basic Foods
lessons.content:
Common Foods

Let's learn some basic food items. Bread is хліб (khlib), water is вода (voda), and milk is молоко (moloko).
